DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 2021-6-10 ak Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.24.18 Released for reuse by CTEP CDE Harmonization. mc  10.26.20

ValueDomain.preferredName: Procedure Subcategory Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a procedure event._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a procedure event.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A subdivision of a procedure event.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. PRSCAT can only be used if there is a PRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of PRCAT.
